head.brief: The head section of the page

body.brief: The body section of the page

parts:
This page allows the telescope to be moved to a given altitude and azimuth.  This is primarily for testing and calibration purposes.
Once in position, the telescope will not 'track' - this functionality is a simple move to a point.
Please input the Altitude and Azimuth in degrees, then press submit, and the instruction to move will be sent to the telescope.

login_template.brief: The template for the login page
head: Part

head.brief: The head section of the page

body.brief: The body section of the page

parts: Members can login to book a session or to control the telescope within a booked session:

input_text.message: The password must be longer than three characters.

parts:
On logging in, a short data string (a 'cookie') is saved to your computer and as you access subsequent pages on this web site it is submitted to confirm your identity and logged in status.

For security reasons the cookie will expire after inactivity.

The cookie is not used to track any other usage for any other parties, and is only useable by this site.

This cookie data is necessary for the operation of the site. Please do not log in if you do not accept this usage.

member_sessions_template.brief: The template for the members sessions page
head: Part

head.brief: The head section of the page

body.brief: The body section of the page

parts: If available, you can book one session per night (with certain exceptions listed here). 'Available' in this context means the timeslot is free, however actual operation is subject to weather, and system failures can also occur. Availability is not assured!
Once booked, the session is reserved for you. If you change your mind, please ensure you free the session.
More than one session per night can be booked for you by the system administrators, however this is only in exceptional circumstances - such as an agreed project or event.
Fifteen minutes prior to an un-booked session starting, it can be booked by anyone, even those who have a session already booked that night. This is to avoid sessions being wasted.
Some sessions may be made unavailable by the system administrators, this will typically be for maintenance, developement or testing purposes.

head.brief: The head section of the page

body.brief: The body section of the page

parts: All times are UTC. Only logged-in users can book a session.
